thread.title: Indonesia Central Bank to Change Dollar Purchase Rules
thread.title_full: Indonesia Central Bank to Change Dollar Purchase Rules - WSJ

author: I Made Sentana
title: Indonesia Central Bank to Change Dollar Purchase Rules
text:
JAKARTA—Bank Indonesia plans to reduce the minimum amount of dollar purchases that must be backed by underlying transactions from $100,000 a month to $25,000 to help ease the pressure on the rupiah.
“We will issue the revised regulation later this month, to help stabilize rupiah’s exchange rate,” Bank Indonesia Governor Agus Martowardojo said.
Such underlying transactions include offshore debt repayments, international trade settlements and dividend payments.
Observers suspect the central bank sold dollars last week as the rupiah fell to lows unseen since the 1998 Asian financial crisis after China devalued the yuan and amid expectations of a U.S. interest rate increase next month.
The central bank has repeatedly said that the rupiah was undervalued and that it would continue to be present in the market to defend the currency.
So far this year, the rupiah has been the second-worst regional performer after the Malaysian ringgit despite Indonesia’s moves to boost the local currency. Earlier this year, for example, Bank Indonesia required all domestic transactions be done in rupiah.
